stanford.androidlib.graphics

Class GLabel

  • java.lang.Object
    • stanford.androidlib.graphics.GObject
      • stanford.androidlib.graphics.GLabel

  • public class GLabel
extends GObject
    The GLabel class is a graphical object whose appearance consists of a text string.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Typeface DEFAULT_FONT
      The default font used to display strings.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GLabel()
      Creates a new empty GLabel object with its top-left corner at (0, 0).
      GLabel(int id)
      Creates a new GLabel object at with its top-left corner (0, 0), initialized to contain the string with the specified resource ID.
      GLabel(int id, float x, float y)
      Creates a new GLabel object with its top-left corner at the specified position.
      GLabel(String str)
      Creates a new GLabel object at with its top-left corner (0, 0), initialized to contain the specified string.
      GLabel(String str, float x, float y)
      Creates a new GLabel object with its top-left corner at the specified position.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_FONT

        public static final Typeface DEFAULT_FONT
        The default font used to display strings. You can change the font by invoking the setFont method.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GLabel

        public GLabel()
        Creates a new empty GLabel object with its top-left corner at (0, 0).
        Usage:
        GLabel glabel = new GLabel();

      • GLabel

        public GLabel(String str)
        Creates a new GLabel object at with its top-left corner (0, 0), initialized to contain the specified string.
        Parameters:
        str - The initial contents of the GLabel
        Usage:
        GLabel glabel = new GLabel(str);

      • GLabel

        public GLabel(String str,
              float x,
              float y)
        Creates a new GLabel object with its top-left corner at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        str - The initial contents of the GLabel
        x - The x-coordinate of the label origin
        y - The y-coordinate of the baseline for the label
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null
        Usage:
        GLabel glabel = new GLabel(str, x, y);

      • GLabel

        public GLabel(@StringRes
              int id)
        Creates a new GLabel object at with its top-left corner (0, 0), initialized to contain the string with the specified resource ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The resource ID of the initial contents of the GLabel
        Usage:
        GLabel glabel = new GLabel(id);

      • GLabel

        public GLabel(@StringRes
              int id,
              float x,
              float y)
        Creates a new GLabel object with its top-left corner at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the resource string for the initial contents of the GLabel
        x - The x-coordinate of the label origin
        y - The y-coordinate of the baseline for the label
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if no string found for given resource ID
        Usage:
        GLabel glabel = new GLabel(str, x, y);

      • getFontSize

        public float getFontSize()
        Returns the font size currently used by this label.

      • setFontStyle

        public void setFontStyle(int style)
        Sets this label to use the given font style, such as TypeFace.BOLD.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if style is not a valid font style

      • setFont

        public void setFont(Typeface font)
        Changes the font used to display the GLabel. This call will usually change the size of the displayed object and will therefore affect the result of calls to getSize and getBounds.
        Parameters:
        font - A Font object indicating the new font
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if font is null
        Usage:
        glabel.setFont(font);

      • setFont

        public void setFont(Typeface font,
                    float size)
        Sets this GLabel to use the given font at the given size.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if size is 0 or negative
        NullPointerException - if font is null

      • setFont

        public void setFont(Typeface fontFamily,
                    int style,
                    float size)
        Sets this GLabel to use the given font at the given style and size.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if size is 0 or negative, or style is not a valid font style
        NullPointerException - if font family is null

      • setFont

        public void setFont(String str)
        Changes the font used to display the GLabel as specified by the string str.
        Parameters:
        str - A String specifying the new font
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the string is null
        Usage:
        glabel.setFont(str);

      • setFontSize

        public void setFontSize(float size)
        Sets this label to use a font of the given size.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if size is 0 or negative

      • setLabel

        public void setLabel(@StringRes
                     int id)
        Changes the string stored within the GLabel object, so that a new text string appears on the display.
        Parameters:
        id - The new string to display's resource ID
        Usage:
        glabel.setLabel(R.string.someID);

      • setLabel

        public void setLabel(String str)
        Changes the string stored within the GLabel object, so that a new text string appears on the display.
        Parameters:
        str - The new string to display
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if string is null
        Usage:
        glabel.setLabel(str);

      • setText

        public void setText(@StringRes
                    int id)
        Changes the string stored within the GLabel object, so that a new text string appears on the display.
        Parameters:
        id - The new string to display's ID
        Usage:
        glabel.setText(R.string.someID);

      • setText

        public void setText(String str)
        Changes the string stored within the GLabel object, so that a new text string appears on the display.
        Parameters:
        str - The new string to display
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if string is null
        Usage:
        glabel.setText(str);
